intro: Juncus prominens, commonly known as the tall rush, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Juncaceae family and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and tall, cylindrical spikes of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swales, and streambanks. It is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife. Its botanical features make it an important component of riparian and wetland ecosystems.
